item.title: Radio Altimeter (RA) Systems (EADI) – Multi-source datalink to GPWS

numlitem.para: GPWS is supplied with altitude data, and
Approach minimums or operating procedures do not require its use.

note.para: Operative Symbol generators must be associated with operative radio altimeters and operative ILS receivers.

operation.para: If the left radio altimeter is failed, the flight crew will see the following flight deck effects for the GEAR NOT DOWN warning:

numlitem.para: If the landing gear is not down and locked, the flaps are retracted, and either engine throttle is at idle the CONFIG warning light will illuminate and the GEAR NOT DOWN EICAS warning message will annunciate; however, the siren will not sound and the master warning lights will not illuminate.

If the landing gear is not down and locked, the flaps are not fully retracted, and either engine throttle is at idle, the gear not down warning will be operative. That is, the CONFIG warning light will illuminate, the GEAR NOT DOWN EICAS warning message will annunciate, the siren will sound and the master warning lights will illuminate.

If the landing gear is not down and locked, the flaps are set at 25 or 30, and the throttles are at any position, the gear not down warning will be operative. The CONFIG warning light will illuminate, the GEAR NOT DOWN EICAS warning message will annunciate, the siren will sound and the master warning lights will illuminate.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1 or CAT 3a as appropriate.

placard.para: Placard near upper EICAS "____RADIO ALTIMETER SYSTEM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: If left radio altimeter is inoperative, select ALTN for Captain’s EFI Instrument Source (for radio altimeter display on Captain’s EADI).
If only right radio altimeter is inoperative, select ALTN for F/O’s EFI Instrument Source (for radio altimeter display on F/O’s EADI).
Check Status Page for display of "GND PROX BITE" message.
If message is not displayed, no further maintenance action is required.
If message is displayed, comply with MEL 34-46-1-0-1 also.

maintenance.para: If left radio altimeter is inoperative, operation of the test switch for the landing configuration warning will show the function to be faulty. However, flap-based monitoring modes of the landing configuration remain operational and can be verified, if desired, as follows:

numlitem.para: Open LDG GEAR POS SYS 1 (11C30) and 2 (11S23) circuit breakers.
With landing flaps extended, all warning indications will be activated.
With flaps up, the configuration warning light and associated EICAS message will illuminate with at least one throttle at idle.
Close LDG GEAR POS SYS 1 and 2 circuit breakers.

note.para: Certain failures of the radio altimeter system will cause one or more of the following messages to be displayed:

maintenance.para: If the Ground Proximity Warning System with multi-source datalink is not receiving radio altitude information from at least one radio altimeter, the GND PROX SYS status message will be annunciated.
